com.brightcove.mobile.mediaapi
Class ReadAPI

java.lang.Object
  com.brightcove.mobile.mediaapi.ReadAPI

public class ReadAPI
extends java.lang.Object

This is a wrapper for the HTTP/JSON Media API provided by Brightcove (http://www.brightcove.com)

The purpose of this library is to provide a simple interface from Java applications to the Brightcove Media API. This class provides the interface to the READ portion of the Media API.

This library relies on the versions of the Apache Commons libraries for networking and the org.json JSON library found in the Android SDK.

For more information on the Media API, see http://support.brightcove.com/en/docs/getting-started-media-api.

Constructor Detail

ReadAPI

public ReadAPI(java.lang.String pReadToken)

Default constructor

Creates a new Read API wrapper object with default settings

  • UTF-8 character set
  • 30 second timeout on HTTP requests

Parameters:
pReadToken - Read Media API token for the account. Note: the privileges of the token can change the fields populated in the returned Video object.
Method Detail

Parameters:
pLog - java.util.logging.Logger object to log to

Sets the Character encoding you want to use.

Parameters:
pCharacterEncoding - Character encoding to use for HTTP URLs and responses

setHttpClient

public void setHttpClient(HttpClient pClient)
Allows for package local classes (unit tests) to specify an alternate HttpClient implementation.

Parameters:
pClient - a valid implementation of HttpClient

setMediaDeliveryType

public void setMediaDeliveryType(MediaDeliveryTypeEnum pMediaDeliveryType)

Sets the MediaDeliveryType to be used by subsequent Read API queries. This determines the type of URL (either HTTP or RTMP) to be returned by the Media API.

Parameters:
pMediaDeliveryType - MediaDeliveryTypeEnum object to determine type of URL in queries

setRegion

public void setRegion(RegionEnum pRegion)
Sets the Region to be used by subsequent Read API queries. This points the Media API calls at api.brightcove.com the US region or api.brightcove.co.jp the JP region.

Parameters:
pRegion - a RegionEnum value

getRegion

public RegionEnum getRegion()
Gets the Region that is being used by Read API queries. This points the Media API calls at api.brightcove.com the US region or api.brightcove.co.jp the JP region.

Returns:
Region a RegionEnum value

findAllVideos

public ItemCollection<Video> findAllVideos(java.lang.Integer pPageSize,
                                           java.lang.Integer pPageNumber,
                                           java.lang.Boolean pGetItemCount,
                                           SortByTypeEnum pSortBy,
                                           SortOrderTypeEnum pSortOrderType,
                                           java.util.EnumSet<VideoFieldEnum> pVideoFields,
                                           java.util.Set<java.lang.String> pCustomFields)
                                    throws java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException,
                                           java.io.IOException,
                                           java.net.MalformedURLException,
                                           JSONException,
                                           BCException,
                                           java.net.URISyntaxException,
                                           java.lang.InterruptedException

Looks in the specified account for all videos

Note: the Media API will only return at most 100 videos per request. To retrieve all videos in the specified account, the caller must request "pages" of 1-100 videos at a time.

Parameters:
pPageSize - Number of videos per page (affects the number of videos returned by this call and the offset dictated by the pageNumber parameter)
pPageNumber - Number of page to request (page size 100 and page number 1 returns videos 100-199)
pSortBy - Sets the field to sort the videos on before cutting up the pages
pSortOrderType - Sets the order to sort the videos in before cutting up the pages
pVideoFields - Set of video fields to populate on the returned Video object
pCustomFields - Set of custom fields to populate on the returned Video object
Returns:
List of Video objects matching criteria
Throws:
java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException - If the request to or response from the Media API could not be properly encoded
java.io.IOException - If a connection could not be made to the Media API
java.net.MalformedURLException - If the URL to connect to the Media API could not be well formed
JSONException - If parsing the JSON response from the Media API fails
BCException - If a Brightcove-specific exception was encountered
java.net.URISyntaxException - If a URL could not be properly built from the parameters provided
java.lang.InterruptedException

findRelatedVideos

public ItemCollection<Video> findRelatedVideos(java.lang.Long pVideoId,
                                               java.lang.String pReferenceId,
                                               java.lang.Integer pPageSize,
                                               java.lang.Integer pPageNumber,
                                               java.util.EnumSet<VideoFieldEnum> pVideoFields,
                                               java.util.Set<java.lang.String> pCustomFields)
                                        throws java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException,
                                               java.io.IOException,
                                               java.net.MalformedURLException,
                                               JSONException,
                                               BCException,
                                               java.net.URISyntaxException,
                                               java.lang.InterruptedException

Looks in the specified account for related videos.

From http:/en/media/:
Finds videos related to the given video. Combines the name and short description of the given video and searches for any partial matches in the name, description, and tags of all videos in the Brightcove media library for this account. More precise ways of finding related videos include tagging your videos by subject and using the find_videos_by_tags method to find videos that share the same tags: or creating a playlist that includes videos that you know are related.

Parameters:
pVideoId - The id of the video we'd like related videos for. Optional (pass null to omit)
pReferenceId - The publisher-assigned reference id of the video we'd like related videos for. Optional (pass null to omit)
pPageSize - Number of items returned per page. A page is a subset of all of the items that satisfy the request. The maximum page size is 100; if you do not set this argument, or if you set it to an integer > 100, your results will come back as if you had set page_size=100. Optional (pass null to omit)
pPageNumber - The zero-indexed number of the page to return. Optional (pass null to omit)
pVideoFields - Set of video fields to populate on the returned Video object.
pCustomFields - Set of custom fields to populate on the returned Video object.
Returns:
List of Video objects matching criteria
Throws:
java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException - If the request to or response from the Media API could not be properly encoded
java.io.IOException - If a connection could not be made to the Media API
java.net.MalformedURLException - If the URL to connect to the Media API could not be well formed
JSONException - If parsing the JSON response from the Media API fails
BCException - If a Brightcove-specific exception was encountered
java.net.URISyntaxException - If a URL could not be properly built from the parameters provided
java.lang.InterruptedException

Retrieves the videos uploaded by the specified user id. This method can be used to find videos submitted using the consumer- generated media (CGM) module.

Parameters:
pUserId - The id of the user whose videos we'd like to retrieve
pPageSize - Number of items returned per page. A page is a subset of all of the items that satisfy the request. The maximum page size is 100; if you do not set this argument, or if you set it to an integer > 100, your results will come back as if you had set page_size=100. Optional (pass null to omit)
pPageNumber - The zero-indexed number of the page to return. Optional (pass null to omit)
pSortBy - Sets the field to sort the videos on before cutting up the pages
pSortOrderType - Sets the order to sort the videos in before cutting up the pages
pVideoFields - Set of video fields to populate on the returned Video object
pCustomFields - Set of custom fields to populate on the returned Video object
Returns:
Video object matching criteria
Throws:
java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException - If the request to or response from the Media API could not be properly encoded
java.io.IOException - If a connection could not be made to the Media API

Performs a search on all the tags of the videos in this account, and returns a collection of videos that contain the specified tags. Note: tags are not case-sensitive

Parameters:
pAndTags - Limit the results to those that contain all of these tags
pOrTags - Limit the results to those that contain at least one of these tags
pPageSize - Number of items returned per page. A page is a subset of all of the items that satisfy the request. The maximum page size is 100; if you do not set this argument, or if you set it to an integer > 100, your results will come back as if you had set page_size=100. Optional (pass null to omit)
pPageNumber - The zero-indexed number of the page to return. Optional (pass null to omit)
pVideoFields - Set of video fields to populate on the returned Video object
pCustomFields - Set of custom fields to populate on the returned Video object

Video object matching criteria

findAllPlaylists

public ItemCollection<Playlist> findAllPlaylists(java.lang.Integer pPageSize,
                                                 java.lang.Integer pPageNumber,
                                                 java.lang.Boolean pGetItemCount,
                                                 SortByTypeEnum pSortBy,
                                                 SortOrderTypeEnum pSortOrderType,
                                                 java.util.EnumSet<VideoFieldEnum> pVideoFields,
                                                 java.util.Set<java.lang.String> pCustomFields,
                                                 java.util.EnumSet<PlaylistFieldEnum> pPlaylistFields)
                                          throws java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException,
                                                 java.io.IOException,
                                                 java.net.MalformedURLException,
                                                 JSONException,
                                                 BCException,
                                                 java.net.URISyntaxException,
                                                 java.lang.InterruptedException

Looks in the specified account for all playlists

Note: the Media API will only return at most 100 playlists per request. So to truly "find all videos", the caller must request "pages" of 1-100 playlists at a time.

Parameters:
pPageSize - Number of playlists per page (affects the number of playlists returned by this call and the offset dictated by the pageNumber parameter)
pPageNumber - Number of page to request (page size 100 and page number 1 returns playlists 100-199)
pSortBy - Sets the field to sort the playlists on before cutting up the pages
pSortOrderType - Sets the order to sort the playlists in before cutting up the pages
pVideoFields - Set of video fields to populate on the returned Video objects
pCustomFields - Set of custom fields to populate on the returned Video objects
pPlaylistFields - A comma-separated list of the fields you wish to have populated in the playlists contained in the returned object. Passing null populates with all fields.
Returns:
List of Playlist objects matching criteria
Throws:
java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException - If the request to or response from the Media API could not be properly encoded
java.io.IOException - If a connection could not be made to the Media API
java.net.MalformedURLException - If the URL to connect to the Media API could not be well formed
JSONException - If parsing the JSON response from the Media API fails
BCException - If a Brightcove-specific exception was encountered
java.net.URISyntaxException - If a URL could not be properly built from the parameters provided
java.lang.InterruptedException

findPlaylistsForPlayerId

public ItemCollection<Playlist> findPlaylistsForPlayerId(java.lang.Long pPlayerId,
                                                         java.lang.Integer pPageSize,
                                                         java.lang.Integer pPageNumber,
                                                         java.util.EnumSet<VideoFieldEnum> pVideoFields,
                                                         java.util.Set<java.lang.String> pCustomFields,
                                                         java.util.EnumSet<PlaylistFieldEnum> pPlaylistFields)
                                                  throws java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException,
                                                         java.io.IOException,
                                                         java.net.MalformedURLException,
                                                         JSONException,
                                                         BCException,
                                                         java.net.URISyntaxException,
                                                         java.lang.InterruptedException

Looks in the specified account for the specified playlists

Finds particular playlists based on player id.

Parameters:
pPlayerId - The player id whose playlists we want to return.
pPageSize - Number of playlists per page (affects the number of playlists returned by this call and the offset dictated by the pageNumber parameter)
pPageNumber - Number of page to request (page size 100 and page number 1 returns playlists 100-199)
pVideoFields - Set of video fields to populate on the returned Video objects
pCustomFields - Set of custom fields to populate on the returned Video objects
pPlaylistFields - A comma-separated list of the fields you wish to have populated in the playlists contained in the returned object. Passing null populates with all fields.
Returns:
Playlist requested
Throws:
java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException - If the request to or response from the Media API could not be properly encoded
java.io.IOException - If a connection could not be made to the Media API
java.net.MalformedURLException - If the URL to connect to the Media API could not be well formed
JSONException - If parsing the JSON response from the Media API fails
BCException - If a Brightcove-specific exception was encountered
java.net.URISyntaxException - If a URL could not be properly built from the parameters provided
